game.games.connect4

Class Connect4Base

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.GameVisualizer
      • game.games.connect4.Connect4Base

  • public class Connect4Base
extends GameVisualizer
    Class which is used for basic Connect4 Logic, namely transforming a current gamestate to an array of doubles, visualizing a gamestate, making a neural net choose a move with a given gamestate, checking if the game is finished and updating the board after a turn

    Note that a gamestate is defined as a sequence of doubles (double array), since this represents the inputs of Neural Nets and Genomes

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Fabian von der Warth
    See Also:
    NeuralNet.feedForward(double[]), Genome.feedForward(double[])

    • Constructor Detail

      • Connect4Base

        public Connect4Base(Game g,
                    java.util.ArrayList<Connect4Event> events,
                    int rows,
                    int columns)
        This constructor is used to create a Connect4Base class which saves the board size and the course of the game. It is only used to then visualize the game with visualize()
        Parameters:
        g - base class game, it should always be a game containing Connect4Event
        events - course of the game in events
        rows - amount of rows in board
        columns - amount of columns in board

    • Method Detail

      • visualize

        public void visualize()
        Visualizes a Connect4Game. It uses a PApplet Sketch
        Specified by:
        visualize in class GameVisualizer
        See Also:
        Connect4Visualizer, PApplet

      • getInput

        public static double[] getInput(int[][] board)
        Transforms a board into a gamestate which is represented as double array.

        The resulting array has a size of rows * columns * 3. It is calculated as follows: For each field in the board there is 3 entries. The first determines if the field is empty. If the field is empty, the resulting entry is 1, else 0. The second entry is 1, if player 1 has a token on the field, else it is 0. The third entry is 1, if player 2 has a token on the field, else it is 0.

        Parameters:
        board - current board
        Returns:
        gamestate as double array

      • getInput2

        public static double[] getInput2(int[][] board)
        Transforms a board into a gamestate which is represented as double array.

        The resulting array has a size of rows * columns. It is calculated as follows: For each field in the board there is 1 entry. The entry is 0, if there is no token on the field, 1 if player 1 has a token on the field, and -1 if player 2 has a token on the field.

        Parameters:
        board - current board
        Returns:
        gamestate as double array

      • getRandom

        public static double[] getRandom(int[][] board)
        Generates a double array with a size of the amount of columns in a board, which is filled with random doubles between 0 and 1. This array can then be used to determine a random move, for example by saying that the resulting move is in the column which has the highest or lowest random number.
        Parameters:
        board - current board
        Returns:
        randomly filled double array

      • think

        public static Connect4ThinkObject think(NeuralNet nn,
                                        int[][] board)
        Makes a neural net feed forward a gamestate of a board. Returns a Connect4ThinkObject which has Connect4ThinkObject.random set to true, if the neural net was null.
        Parameters:
        nn - NeuralNet which the gamestate should be fed into
        board - current board
        Returns:
        Connect4ThinkObject result of the forward propagation, it contains a random double array if the neural net was null
        See Also:
        NeuralNet.feedForward(double[]), getInput(int[][]), getInput2(int[][]), getRandom(int[][]), Connect4ThinkObject

      • think

        public static Connect4ThinkObject think(Genome g,
                                        int[][] board)
        Makes a neural net represented as genome feed forward a gamestate of a board. Returns a Connect4ThinkObject which has Connect4ThinkObject.random set to true, if the genome was null.
        Parameters:
        g - Genome which the input should be fed into
        board - current board
        Returns:
        Connect4ThinkObject result of the forward propagation, it contains a random double array if the genome was null
        See Also:
        Genome.feedForward(double[]), getInput(int[][]), getInput2(int[][]), getRandom(int[][]), Connect4ThinkObject

      • columnFilled

        public static boolean columnFilled(int column,
                                   int[][] board)
        returns true if the specified column is already filled with tokens, false if it is not.
        Parameters:
        column - to be checked column
        board - current board
        Returns:
        true if full, false if not full

      • getRow

        public static int getRow(int column,
                         int[][] board)
        Gets the next row which a token will be placed in in the specified column
        Parameters:
        column - to be checked column
        board - current board
        Returns:
        -1 if column is full, else the row which is next to be filled with a token.

      • enterGameEventInBoard

        public static int[][] enterGameEventInBoard(Connect4Event e,
                                            int[][] board)
        Adds a token to the board, where the token should be put is specified in the given event.
        Parameters:
        e - event which should be entered on the board
        board - current board
        Returns:
        updated board

      • ueberpruefeEndbedingung

        public static boolean ueberpruefeEndbedingung(Connect4Event e,
                                              int[][] board)
        Checks if the specified game event created a row of four.
        Parameters:
        e - event which was last entered on board
        board - current board
        Returns:
        true if the game is finished, false if not
